content.description:
This question involves processing an email address to create three usernames.

The email address is stored in a  String  variable named  email,  which consists of a first name, followed by  ".",  followed by a last name, followed by  "@",  followed by a domain name. Assume that the email address is stored in this format and the last name has at least three characters.

The usernames will be formatted as follows.

Username 1 will consist of the first name, followed by  "_",  followed by the last name.

Username 2 will consist of the first initial of the first name, followed by  "_",  followed by the last name.

Username 3 will consist of a randomly-selected character from the first name , followed by  "_",  followed by a sequence of three consecutive characters selected from a random position in the last name.

Example 1
Suppose  email  is equal to  "joseph.martin@school.org".

Username 1 will be  "joseph_martin".

Username 2 will be "j_martin".

Possible values of Username 3 include  "s_art"  and  "p_tin".

Example 2
Suppose  email  is equal to  "virginia.farmingham@school.net".

Username 1 will be  "virginia_farmingham".

Username 2 will be "v_farmingham".

Possible values of Username 3 include  "g_ham"  and  "i_arm".
content.question: Write a statement that uses the  String  method  indexOf  to find the index of the first  "."  in email and assign it to a variable. Write another statement that uses the  String  method  indexOf  to find the index of  "@"  and assign it to a variable.
